On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: Marius-Viorel Iacob:

From the screenshots it seems like a substring of the value of x-transaction-id key from the header of the request resolves as a credit card number.

@Marius Ghiurcau can we do something about this?

[DevOps CommentId:10654434]

On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: The customer has followed up on this, can you please share an update to the topic, that I can forward to him?
Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: The customer has followed up on this, can you please share an update to the topic, that I can forward to him?

On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: Mara Dobse:

For this issue an easy workaround could be whitelisting "x.com" domain if there is no need for tracking it.
The issue does not reproduce on my end so I was not able to properly test this but from the logs I figured we can ignore the scanning of the specific request that contains the threat based on its content type. You can find a test build containing the fix here: \192.168.14.5Publicgroups_daily_buildsCoSoSys2024-builds2024_08_23EppMac_v3.0.3.0021.
Please be advised to install this only on one or a few machines as this is only a test build.

On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: Mara Dobse:

The issue in the screenshots from the escalation attachments folder is related to DPI settings rather than the fix from the test build. Please reinstall the client and make sure the certificates are up to date and trusted everywhere it is necessary.
If the problem still occurs please collect extended DPI logs and attach them in the escalation folder.

[DevOps CommentId:11089428]

On Escalation Ticket # 00415618 the new comment has been added: Cristian-Alexandru Halmajan:

Hi @WaitingOnEngineer,

Please see below feedback from de team:

"The issue in the screenshots from the escalation attachments folder is related to DPI settings rather than the fix from the test build. Please reinstall the client and make sure the certificates are up to date and trusted everywhere it is necessary.
If the problem still occurs please collect extended DPI logs and attach them in the escalation folder."
